reviews.review_msg: Gail is super knowledgeable and has had a really impressive career. But unfortunately, this class was quite painful. Although the lecture videos were engaging, there are so many side assignments/discussions to complete weekly. There was no midterm, but the final exam was 120 short answer questions to complete in 3 hours. Literally impossible!!!!!!!
Such an interesting course and a prof which makes it so easy to understand and follow along. Clear instructions, assignments to be completed weekly but it's manageable. Would recommend this prof!!!

Exams were entirely written, 23-37 short answer questions, absolutely way too many written questions for the time limit. TA took 1 week to respond to emails and sometimes did not respond at all, even when asking questions in the "tutor marker office" discussion forum. No help was given by the TA or prof at all. Completely self taught class. Avoid.

Everything revolves around the textbook. Weekly readings are very long and time consuming. The content is challenging but interesting; the midterm and final are completely written short answer questions (x22 of them); the midterm was rough. Nevertheless, I recommend this as an elective purely because its online.

Class text was written by the prof, exams/assignments involve memorizing the textbook. There are no lectures, just this boring, hard to read, biology-heavy, long and drawn out textbook that reads like a literature review in an academic journal article. The text is awful and I feel that we are only told to buy it so prof can make money from sales

Hands down the best professor I have ever encountered at Simon Fraser, I think this professor is one of the reasons the Criminology department stands out at SFU across the country. High expectations, as well as a hard marker, but cares about the success of her students. I have never encountered an unfair exam. I think SFU is very lucky to have Gail

The final for this class is absolutely ridiculous. Questions based on personal opinions rather than material covered. Was doing great in the class up until the end. Beware that no amount of studying can prepare you for the irrelevant questions that are asked on the final exam - which is worth 40%

I have taken a few of her courses online and in class and she is a great prof, true expert in her field, clear expectations in courses.  Lecture material in class important for exams, textbook important for online course exams.  You learn alot.

I took this class online and it was all based on the textbook. The exams were tough, but if you study hard it shouldn't be too hard. The TA graded the exams hard. You had to take all your notes from the textbook (no modules- just a general outline of the chapter). You need to work hard to achieve a good grade.

Distance Ed, this class is not easy. Final did not test your knowledge but had some questions that were irrelevant to the course.. overall if you intersted in biology you might like it otherwise for extra credits id recommend another course. Tests were annoying, hard and no entirely fair, participation easy marks tho. TA Jodie was good.
